qas.question: Where were aristocrats buried from the Middle Ages?
Geoffrey Chaucer was employed as what?
Where were aristocrats buried from the Later Ages?
Where were aristocrats burned from the Middle Ages?
Geoffrey Chaucer was unemployed as what?
Geoffrey Chaucer wasn't employed as what?

context: From the Middle Ages, aristocrats were buried <a0_0><b3_0><b4_0>inside chapels<b4_0/><b3_0/><a0_0/>, while monks and other people associated with the abbey were buried in the cloisters and other areas. One of these was Geoffrey Chaucer, who was buried here as he had apartments <a2_0><b7_0>in the abbey<b7_0/><a2_0/> where he was employed as <a1_0><b5_0><b6_0>master of the King's Works<b6_0/><b5_0/><a1_0/>. Other poets, writers and musicians were buried or memorialised around Chaucer in what became known as Poets' Corner. Abbey musicians such as Henry Purcell were also buried in their place of work.[citation needed]
